task_summary: Perceive bread and plate, approach the bread, push it left onto the plate, verify placement, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 end-effector operates over a green tablecloth with a white oval plate and a small bread piece to its right. The sequence shows approach from the right, contact, a lateral push moving the bread onto the plate, and a retreat. The behavior favors push-based placement over grasping, matching the visual evidence. Key constraints include keeping motion planar, modest timeouts, and a short retreat to clear the field of view for verification.
preconditions: Workspace clear with plate and bread visible
Gripper free and above the surface
stepwise_plan: Move above bread at small height
Orient tool yaw for lateral push
success_criteria: Bread ends resting on the plate
No object in gripper after task
Robot safely clear from plate at end
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, rescan; if alignment off, re-approach; if push insufficient, repeat push; if collision risk, retreat and reorient
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after verification detects bread_on_plate and the arm has retreated and waited.

frame_3.now_evidence: First visible contact between gripper and bread with alignment for a leftward motion.
frame_3.predicts_next: A push action is expected to translate the bread toward the plate.

node_specs.description: Vision detection of the bread before approach.
Detect the plate to plan push direction.
Move above the bread at a safe clearance.
Rotate the tool to align for side push.
Precisely align to the bread edge.
Push the bread left toward the plate.
Verify the bread is on the plate.
Back off to clear the workspace.

failure_modes: Bread not detected due to glare
recovery_strategy: Retreat and adjust yaw before retry
assumptions: Instruction says 'picking', but frames show push-based placement; tree follows the frames and logs this mismatch.

expected_success_criteria: Bread remains on plate center-left region
End-effector clear of plate at end
